title: ID: Semiserif free font
content:
I know it’s not the most beautiful font in the world, but I need to know if you have seen this face before.

Since it looks amateurish I looked for it in some free font sites, but no luck. Anyone?

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20131018221742im_/http:/typophile.com/files/SemiserifID_6051.png)
author: Cristobal Henestrosa

comments.content:
Nothing in my Serif Guide matches it. It's a new one to me.

- Mike Yanega
Well, Mike, if you don’t recognize it, maybe no one can do it… Thanks!

You're kidding, right? Plenty of people here know fonts I don't. I just wanted to let you know that I looked. Now I'm looking forward to the answer too.

- Mike Yanega
can you tell us the source?
That feels vintage to me. It could be a lettering sample rather than type.
Sorry about the mysterious answer, but let’s say that someone gave me a .vfb file, and some anomalies in it brought to my mind certain doubts about who the author of the work is.
